com.libertyglobal.PotatoMarket.controllers

Class PotatoMarketController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.libertyglobal.PotatoMarket.controllers.PotatoMarketController

  • @RestController
public class PotatoMarketController
extends java.lang.Object
    Controller exposing REST API endpoints for the resource Potato Bag. Here the controller exposes two methods:
    1. GET : Fetch requested number of Potato Bags. Quantity is mentioned in query parameter. If not mentioned default is 3.
    2. POST : Add a potato bag to the list of Potato Bags.
    Author:
    Rabindra Rakshit

        @RequestMapping(value="/PotatoBag",
                method=POST)
public java.lang.Object newPotatoBag(@Valid @RequestBody

                                                                                                        org.springframework.validation.Errors errors)
                                                                                                 throws CustomException

      • listPotatoBags

        @RequestMapping(value="/PotatoBag",
                method=GET,
                produces="application/json")
public PotatoBags listPotatoBags(@RequestParam(value="itemCount",defaultValue="3")
                                                                                                                                                 java.lang.String itemCount)
        GET method allowing to fetch the mentioned number of Potato Bags. Quantity is mentioned in query parameter (itemCount). If not mentioned default is 3.
        Parameters:
        itemCount - Parameter mentioning the number of Potato Bag details to be fetched.
        Returns:
        Details of the requested number of Potato Bags.
